intro: Chaetanthera sericea, commonly known as silky chaetanthera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in coastal and sandy environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and covered in a fine layer of silky hairs, contributing to its common name. Chaetanthera sericea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sunlight.
